ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: This study would not have been possible without close cooperation and active participation of the BC Ministry of Forests, Lands, and Natural Resource Operations (Ryan Midgley, Caren Dymond, Dennis Paradine, and James Sandland). We thank the Canadian Forest Service colleagues Max Fellows and Michael Magnan in the Carbon Accounting Team for their contributions to the carbon modeling. We also thank Mark Boyland and Minet Prinsloo in the Economic Analysis Division, Canadian Forest Service, for providing economic data and advice, and all of our collaborators for their support in developing model inputs. Finally, we thank Dan McKenney, Thomas White, James Sandland, Dennis Paradine, Caren Dymond, and three anonymous reviewers for reviewing earlier versions of this paper. Funding for this study was provided by the Pacific Institute for Climate Solutions and Natural Resources Canada. However, the authors accept full responsibility for the assumptions made in this analysis. The views expressed in this study do not necessarily reflect the positions of the Government of British Columbia or the Government of Canada.
